tags.name: Commenting System
tags.description: These apps are commonly used to provide the web site with some kind of commenting functionality

tags.name: Local Analytics
tags.description: These trackers are usually operated as self-hosted solutions by the first party web sites

tags.name: Feedback
tags.description: These companies offer widgets and other tools that help operators gather and respond to feedback

tags.name: Polls
tags.description: Theses companies offer widgets that are used in asking site visitors simple questions and aggregating results in a poll result

tags.name: Pornvertising
tags.description: This is a collection of advertisers that most often appear on pornographic sites

tags.name: Tag Manager
tags.description: This is a collection of applications that provide third party tag management

tags.name: Video Player
tags.description: This group contains applications, advertisers, and trackers that are usually required for serving video content. If you are missing a video player or your video isn't working, this is the best tag to start with

tags.name: Website Chat
tags.description: These applications are generally used to provide an ability for site operator to chat with visitors

tags.name: History Sniffing
tags.description: These entries are known to "sniff" your browsing history, meaning, they check which sites you've visisted in the past

tags.name: Font System
tags.description: Font system groups trackers that also affect how your fonts are rendered on the web sites

tags.name: Device Fingerprinting
tags.description: Apps in these categories are able to identify and id a user across multiple devices

tags.name: Clipboard Tampering
tags.description: These apps like to steal and modify the contents of your clipboard

tags.name: Clipboard Sniffing
tags.description: These apps like to steal the contents of your clipboard without asking you

tags.name: Behavior Tracking
tags.description: These apps engage in tracking your behaviour or deriving your behavioural traits through traffic examination

tags.name: Audio / Music Player
tags.description: Are you listening to a radio show and it stops working? Are you expecting a music player on this page? These companies may be responsible for this issue

tags.name: Visitor De-anonymization
tags.description: These apps are actively engaged in identifying a particular browser session to the actual user using that browser

tags.name: Cookie Respawning
tags.description: These entities are known to re-spawn your unique id via techiniques like evercookie

tags.name: In-Text Ads
tags.description: A tag for advertising companies that like to provide annoying ads in-text via deceptive hyperlinks

tags.name: Affiliate Marketing
tags.description: Advertising generated by these apps is known as affiliate marketing

tags.name: Site Optimization
tags.description: These apps provide various means to optimize visited sites

tags.name: A/B Testing
tags.description: Tracking apps that provide A/B testing scaffolds for web-sites

tags.name: Search
tags.description: These apps are involved in providing off-site search, so if search functionality is broken these are the entries to look at

tags.name: Segment Data
tags.description: These apps are involved in deriving segmentation data through the tracking

tags.name: E-mail Analytics
tags.description: Apps that collect information on how well an email campaign is working

tags.name: Social
tags.description: All kinds of social sharing widgets that are easily recognizable

tags.name: Toolbar
tags.description: These apps provide toolbars such as G+ that appear across multiple sites

tags.name: Interstitials
tags.description: An inredibly annoying advertising technique that forces a user to see an ad that appears between certain content or before they could access some content. These apps enable it

tags.name: Popunders
tags.description: A type of self-explanatory advertising that these apps engage in

tags.name: Lead Management
tags.description: These apps are designed to generate new potential business clientele by connecting outgoing consumer advertising with the responses to that advertising.

tags.name: Live Traffic Widget
tags.description: Apps that provide live web or site traffic, maps, and other visuals

tags.name: Open Source
tags.description: These apps are open source

tags.name: Overlays
tags.description: Another annoying advertising tehnique that involves content overlays that have to be closed prior to seeing content. Apps doing this are grouped here

tags.name: Popups
tags.description: A type of self-explanatory advertising that these apps engage in
